creator: scohen@apache.org
text:
"Overriding previous definition of reference " log messages do not respect even
the quiet flag when invoking ant.  They always appear.  I always ignore them.  I
always know that I have done this.  

I would question that they should even appear in the normal setting, as they are
not particularly useful to me, but at the very least, they should not appear
when quiet is asked for.

I have a target that generates these, and I havn't been able to figue out why.
Can you provide a build file to duplicate this behavior (though I have to admit
it has been very low priority and I havn't tried too hard). Perhaps that will
shed light on why this happens, particularly when I compare it with my build file.
creator: gus.heck@olin.edu
scohen@apache.org
text:
It's a fairly complicated build system, I can't send you a simple file, but
basically, it's this way:

I have a file called "template-targets.xml" which is included in several other
build files via the mechanism of &entity inclusion.  These "template targets"
perform their work on various named filesets and patternsets whose actual
content is often redefined in the different subordinate build files, each of
which includes template-targets.xml, and all of which are launched by a master
build script which controls the whole thing.

This scheme works decently, but the message noise as these overrides happen is a
minor aggravation.

Does this help you understand the circumstances?  If not, I can give more
explanation.

I would agree on changing the override definition messages to make them have a 
verbose output.
creator: antoine@apache.org
gus.heck@olin.edu
text:
Hmm sounds more complex than my situation. I'm wondering what task you might be
running when it occurs. In my case it occurs uncomfortably close to a task I
wrote :) and that scares me :). But I've gone over my code and can't think of
anything that would involve redefinition of classes. It must be some interaction
with the whole UnknownElement thing, I am guessing. (which I keep reading about
on the list, but havn't taken the time to fully understand).

creator: scohen@apache.org
text:
The task I am running when these messages appear is either <ant> or <antcall>. 
I completely understand why <ant> would redefine these references.  I'm not sure
it's appropriate for <antcall> to redefine all references.  But even if it is
appropriate, I still don't need to see the messages.

I think Antoine's solution is appropriate - just make whatever is spitting out
these log message to do so only at the verbose level.  Determining why <antcall>
within the same build file redefines references and whether this is in fact
necessary is something else that might be investigated.

ok in which case it appears unrelated to my case and just quieting things down
is probably ok for now.
creator: gus.heck@olin.edu

text:
Any chance this can get into 1.6.3?  Making these messages only be output in
-verbose mode doesn't sound like a real difficult or risky change.  How about
doing it sooner than later?

Jake
creator: hoju@visi.com

text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 17240 ***
creator: mbenson@apache.org
